titleStmt.title: Three speeches of the Right Honorable, Sir Francis Bacon Knight, then his Majesties Sollicitor Generall, after Lord Verulam, Viscount Saint Alban. Concerning the post-nati naturalization of the Scotch in England union of the lawes of the kingdomes of England and Scotland. Published by the authors copy, and licensed by authority.
titleStmt.author: Bacon, Francis, 1561-1626.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Richard Badger, for Samuel Broun, and are to be sold at his shop in St. Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the white Lyon and Ball,

notesStmt.note: The words "post-nati .. Scotland." are bracketed together on title page.
There exist two states of this edition. In state #1: the word "Chancecellor" appears on page 1, line 5. In state #2: the word is spelled "Chancellor". --Cf. Gibson, R.W. Bacon.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shop in St. Pauls Church-yard at the signe of the white Lyon
